analyzed: chang nya bud med rnams kyi dri ma gsum bral aa ba dh'u ti dmang rigs cis ma yin //

analyzed: gang dag dngos po du mar gyur pa ser skya pa ni gcig pu nyid du dam 'cha' la //
translated: Those who are of many things, the followers of Kapila, are bound to the one thing only.

original: gang gis bsgrub bya med pa nyid la brtan g-yo'i 'gro ba yod pa nyid du dam 'ca' ba //
analyzed: gang gis bsgrub bya med pa nyid la brtan g-yo'i 'gro ba yod pa nyid du dam 'ca' ba //
translated: Those who are bound to the nonexistence of the object, the existence of the world of the moving and unmoving,

original: gang tshe gtan tshigs bsgrub bya dang mtshungs gyur pa de tshe sgrub pa po yis bsgrub bya min //
analyzed: gang tshe gtan tshigs bsgrub bya dang mtshungs gyur pa de tshe sgrub pa po yis bsgrub bya min //
translated: When the reason is the same as the probandum, then the proponent has no probandum.

original: gal te bsgrub bya gzhan la gtan tshigs kyang gzhan gyur pa de tshe de yi dam bca' nyams //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub bya gzhan la gtan tshigs kyang gzhan gyur pa de tshe de yi dam bca' nyams //
translated: If the probandum is one thing and the reason another, then the thesis is contradicted.

original: sgra rnams rtag par dam bca' nam mkha' lta bur byas pa'i lus med par grub de bzhin du //
analyzed: sgra rnams rtag par dam bca' nam mkha' lta bur byas pa'i lus med par grub de bzhin du //
translated: The thesis that sounds are permanent is established by the example of space, which has no body.

original: sgra rnams mi rtag dam bca' bum pa lta bur byas te shin tu rtsol bas byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra rnams mi rtag dam bca' bum pa lta bur byas te shin tu rtsol bas byung ba'i phyir //
translated: The thesis that sounds are impermanent is established by the example of a pot, because it is produced by great effort.

original: nams mkha' las ni rtag bar grub kyang khyod kyi kha las sgra rnams mi rtag nges par grub //
analyzed: nams mkha' las ni rtag bar grub kyang khyod kyi kha las sgra rnams mi rtag nges par grub //
translated: Although space is established as permanent, from your mouth the impermanence of sounds is definitely established.

original: gzugs dang reg bya dri dan @195b ro yi yul rnams bzhin du lnga pa sgra yang cis ma yin //
analyzed: gzugs dang reg bya dri dan @195b ro yi yul rnams bzhin du lnga pa sgra yang cis ma yin //
translated: Why is sound not the fifth among the objects of form, touch, taste, and smell?

original: de ni gang gis thog mar rtogs pas sa steng bar snang khams su sgra des slar yang ni //
analyzed: de ni gang gis thog mar rtogs pas sa steng bar snang khams su sgra des slar yang ni //
translated: That is understood first by anyone, and then again by that sound on earth and in the sky.

original: rna bas don rnams rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni sgra nams rtag pa nyid yin lo //
analyzed: rna bas don rnams rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni sgra nams rtag pa nyid yin lo //
translated: The ear, which is the means of knowing the meaning, is permanent.

original: gang gis thog mar don rtogs gyur pas sa steng bar snang khams su slar yang de tshul gyis //
analyzed: gang gis thog mar don rtogs gyur pas sa steng bar snang khams su slar yang de tshul gyis //

analyzed: rna bas don rnams nges par rtogs par gyur pas de ci gzugs rnams rtag pa nyid yin nam //
translated: known by the ear. Is it permanent?

original: rtag pa gsal bya gcig pu yon tan ma lus rang bzhin sgra zhig rna ba'i bug par gnas //
analyzed: rtag pa gsal bya gcig pu yon tan ma lus rang bzhin sgra zhig rna ba'i bug par gnas //
translated: The permanent, single manifestor, the sound which is the nature of all qualities, is located in the ear-hole.

original: mgrin pa nas brjod gsal byed sgra yi tshogs rnams slar yang rtag par gyur pa ma yin la //
analyzed: mgrin pa nas brjod gsal byed sgra yi tshogs rnams slar yang rtag par gyur pa ma yin la //
translated: The collection of manifestor sounds, uttered from the throat, are not again permanent.

original: gang zhig brjod pa gcig gis nyan byed rna ba'i bu gar sgra yi ku cor 'gyur min nam //
analyzed: gang zhig brjod pa gcig gis nyan byed rna ba'i bu gar sgra yi ku cor 'gyur min nam //
translated: Is it not the case that the sound-noise in the ear-hole is from a single utterance?

original: rtag par mngon par gsal bya de ltar 'gyur gyi gzhan la ltos pas nus pa'ang min //
analyzed: rtag par mngon par gsal bya de ltar 'gyur gyi gzhan la ltos pas nus pa'ang min //
translated: It would be so, if the manifestor were permanent, but it is not possible by dependence on another.

original: dngos po'i byed po'i rgyu ni slar yang mun pa gsal bar byed pa gzhan na gnas pas ni //
analyzed: dngos po'i byed po'i rgyu ni slar yang mun pa gsal bar byed pa gzhan na gnas pas ni //
translated: The cause of the agent of the thing, again, is not the manifestor of darkness, which is located elsewhere.

original: rtag pa mngon par gsal bar byas pa gang zhig rgyu yis bskyed pa 'dir ni byas pas te //
analyzed: rtag pa mngon par gsal bar byas pa gang zhig rgyu yis bskyed pa 'dir ni byas pas te //
translated: What is manifested by the permanent is produced by a cause, and is therefore created.

original: byas pa dang ni gzhan pa gang dag chos mi mthun pas grub par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin //
analyzed: byas pa dang ni gzhan pa gang dag chos mi mthun pas grub par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin //
translated: And what is created is not the same as what is not created, because of the difference in their properties.

analyzed: chos mi mthun par de phyir byas ba rnams ni yod par 'gyur la gcig shos de med do //
translated: Therefore, what is created exists, but what is not created does not exist.

original: gang zhig mngon par gsal bya'i rgyur gyur mngon par gsal byed de ni ci yis rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: gang zhig mngon par gsal bya'i rgyur gyur mngon par gsal byed de ni ci yis rgyu ma yin //
translated: What is the cause of manifestation is not the cause of what is manifested.

original: mun par thim par gyur pa gang dag de yis mngon par @196a *//
analyzed: mun par thim par gyur pa gang dag de yis mngon par @196a *//
translated: What is manifested by it, having been dissolved in darkness,

original: gsal byas de yi 'bras bu cis ma yin //
analyzed: gsal byas de yi 'bras bu cis ma yin //
translated: how can it be the effect of that?

original: sgra dang don dag gal te gcig par gyur na de tshe don nyams pa na sgra nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gal te gcig par gyur na de tshe don nyams pa na sgra nyams 'gyur //
translated: If the word and the object were the same, then when the object is destroyed, the word would be destroyed.

original: spyi dang gsal ba'ang de bzhin 'gyur te nam mkha' tsam dang gzhan pa nyid dang gcig pa nying //
analyzed: spyi dang gsal ba'ang de bzhin 'gyur te nam mkha' tsam dang gzhan pa nyid dang gcig pa nying //
translated: The universal and the particular would be the same, like space, or different.

original: stong ba sgra dang ldan par gyur na de tshe 'jig rten gsum por rtag tu sgra med 'gyur //
analyzed: stong ba sgra dang ldan par gyur na de tshe 'jig rten gsum por rtag tu sgra med 'gyur //
translated: If emptiness were to become endowed with sound, then the three worlds would always be without sound.

original: gang gis nam mkha' yod pa nyid na brtan dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba des na med pa nyid //
analyzed: gang gis nam mkha' yod pa nyid na brtan dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba des na med pa nyid //
translated: If space exists, then the moving and unmoving worlds would be without it.

original: gal te nam mkha' dang ni 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi rgyu dag chos mi mthun las grub gyur na //
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' dang ni 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi rgyu dag chos mi mthun las grub gyur na //
translated: If space were to be established from a cause that is a collection of elements that are dissimilar,

analyzed: de yi rgyu las sgra dang sgra min dman par nges par sgrub pa po la nges par 'gyur //
translated: then the creator would certainly establish sound and non-sound as inferior from its cause.üîΩOn the earth and in the sky, the planets and stars, animals and humans,

analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyi rang bzhin yon tan dbang las dbyibs dang kha dog rang bzhin gyi //
translated: are the nature of the syllables of mantra by the power of qualities, shape, and nature.

analyzed: don gcig du ma'i sgra yis kha cig tu yang don rnams mang po de ni sgra gcig gis //
translated: One meaning is sometimes many sounds, and many meanings are sometimes one sound.

original: dngos med stong pa'i rgyu las brtan dang g-yo ba'i dngos po rgyu rnams las ni grub pas na //
analyzed: dngos med stong pa'i rgyu las brtan dang g-yo ba'i dngos po rgyu rnams las ni grub pas na //
translated: From a cause that is an unreal void, things that are stable and moving are established from causes.

analyzed: dpe ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ni sa dang shing dang me tog de der rang rang grub //
translated: The examples are a sky flower, earth, a tree, and that flower, each established in its own place.

analyzed: mo gsham bu mo nam mkha' tsam las skyes pa nam mkhar 'gyur la bu ldan las skyes pa //
translated: The son of a barren woman is born from space alone, and space becomes one who has a son.

original: bu ni 'gro ba ma lus par 'gyur shin tu phra ba'i rdul phra na phung po'i sa @196b bon las //
analyzed: bu ni 'gro ba ma lus par 'gyur shin tu phra ba'i rdul phra na phung po'i sa @196b bon las //
translated: The son is all beings, and the extremely subtle particles are the seed of the aggregates.

original: sa dang chu dang me rnams lha yi de nyid khyad par rnams ni phyi dang tha dad min //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me rnams lha yi de nyid khyad par rnams ni phyi dang tha dad min //
translated: Earth, water, and fire are the special realities of the gods, not separate from the outside.

original: gal te lhan cig rab tu 'jig par gyur na de tshe tha dad gzugs dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig rab tu 'jig par gyur na de tshe tha dad gzugs dang lhan cig tu //
translated: If they were to be destroyed together, then they would be destroyed together with separate forms.

original: sa dang chu me rnams lha yi de nyid gcig pa nyid du rab tu 'jig pa min //
analyzed: sa dang chu me rnams lha yi de nyid gcig pa nyid du rab tu 'jig pa min //
translated: Earth, water, and fire are not destroyed as the same reality of the gods.

original: srog chags so so'i lus ni 'jig pa rnam par bral ba'i 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi lha rnams te //
analyzed: srog chags so so'i lus ni 'jig pa rnam par bral ba'i 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi lha rnams te //
translated: The individual bodies of living beings are the gods of the collection of elements that are free from destruction.

analyzed: sa dang chu dang byin za rlung dang nam mkha' sbyor bas gang zhig rnam lnga'i bdag nyid lus //
translated: The body is the five elements, earth, water, fire, air, and space.

analyzed: lus can rnams la yon tan bral ba'i lha rnams rnam lnga der ni mthong min yod ces grags //
translated: The five gods, who are devoid of qualities, are not seen in the body of embodied beings, but are said to exist there.

original: srog chags rnams ni sngon gyi lus po spangs nas slar yang lus gzhan bsam pas 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: srog chags rnams ni sngon gyi lus po spangs nas slar yang lus gzhan bsam pas 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: Beings, having abandoned their former bodies, again assume other bodies by the power of thought.

original: gang zhig sa la sogs pa'i lha rnams de yi sngon gyi lus po zhig pas rab 'jig 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig sa la sogs pa'i lha rnams de yi sngon gyi lus po zhig pas rab 'jig 'gyur //
translated: The gods of earth and so on are destroyed by the destruction of their former bodies.

original: srog chags gzugs gzhan glog gi phreng ba chen po bzhin du rab tu rgya chen gzugs can te //
analyzed: srog chags gzugs gzhan glog gi phreng ba chen po bzhin du rab tu rgya chen gzugs can te //
translated: Beings have a form that is vast like a great garland of lightning,

original: sprin bor nas ni bar snang dag la phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su mgyogs pa'i shugs kyis 'gro //
analyzed: sprin bor nas ni bar snang dag la phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su mgyogs pa'i shugs kyis 'gro //
translated: and having abandoned the clouds, they move through the directions and intermediate directions in the sky with the speed of thought.

original: srog chags srog dang lhan cig bem po'i lus dang bral ba tshor ba la sogs rab ldan pa //
analyzed: srog chags srog dang lhan cig bem po'i lus dang bral ba tshor ba la sogs rab ldan pa //
translated: Beings, together with their life force, are devoid of material bodies, but are endowed with feelings and so on.

original: srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig rnams su dge dang mi dge'i dbang gis gcig pu kho nar 'gro //
analyzed: srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig rnams su dge dang mi dge'i dbang gis gcig pu kho nar 'gro //
translated: In the thirty-one existences, by the power of virtue and nonvirtue, one goes alone.

original: gcig min rnam pa lnga po yul dang bral ba nang gi bdag dang mchog gi bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: gcig min rnam pa lnga po yul dang bral ba nang gi bdag dang mchog gi bdag nyid ni //
translated: Not one, but fivefold, free from objects, the inner self and the nature of the supreme self,

original: nam mkha' las 'das mi gsal min zhing mi gsal 'bras bu med min nus pa dman pa min //
analyzed: nam mkha' las 'das mi gsal min zhing mi gsal 'bras bu med min nus pa dman pa min //
translated: not beyond space, not unclear, not without a clear result, not of inferior capacity,

original: sems las 'dod pas @197a *//
analyzed: sems las 'dod pas @197a *//
translated: desired from the mind.

original: rang bzhin skyes bu 'byung ba min zhing srog rlung med na sems med la //
analyzed: rang bzhin skyes bu 'byung ba min zhing srog rlung med na sems med la //
translated: The natural man does not arise, without the life-force wind, there is no mind.

original: srog chags sems dang lhan cig bde 'gro ngan 'gro dag tu las kyi 'brel pas 'jug /
analyzed: srog chags sems dang lhan cig bde 'gro ngan 'gro dag tu las kyi 'brel pas 'jug /
translated: With the life-force and mind, through the connection of karma, beings enter into good and bad rebirths.

translated: then the elements, which are subject to change, are certainly subject to change.

original: thams cad 'gyur med rtag pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur yang na gang zhig rtag pa nyid ni 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: thams cad 'gyur med rtag pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur yang na gang zhig rtag pa nyid ni 'gyur ba med //
translated: If everything were unchanging and permanent, then nothing would change.

translated: The all-pervading Lord, whether eternal or non-eternal, has been declared to be the creator of the world.üîΩBecause of mutual dependence, consciousness and the self are cause and effect.

analyzed: phan tshun ltos phyir byas pa min dang byas pa dag kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur //
